intro: Phacelia hallii, commonly known as the Hall's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phacelia hallii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
